gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਕਥਾ ੳੁਹ ਠੌਰ ਭੲੀ || ਅਬ ਰਾਮ ਜਯਾ ਪਰ ਬਾਤ ਗੲੀ ||
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Kathaa Uh Thaur Bhaee|| Ab Raam Jayaa Par Baat Gade||
translation: In this way, the story advanced in Oudh and now the part of the mother of Ram comes before us.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਹੜਾਮ ਜਹਾਂ ਸੁਨੀਅੈ ਸਹਰੰ || ਤਹ ਕੌਸਲ ਰਾਜ ਨ੍ਰਿਪੇਸ ਬਰੰ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Kuhdaam Jahaan Souneeai Sahran|| Tah Kaousal Raaj Nripes Baran||10||
translation: There was a brave king in the city of Kuhram, which was known as the kingdom of Kaushal.10.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਪਜੀ ਤਹ ਧਾਮ ਸੁਤਾ ਕੁਸਲੰ || ਜਿਹ ਜੀਤ ਲੲੀ ਸਸ ਅੰਗ ਕਲੰ ||
transliteration: Oupjitah Dhaam Soutaa Kousalan|| Jih Jeet Laisas An Kalan||
translation: In his home was born an extremely beautiful daughter Kaushalya, who conquered all the beauty of the moon.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹੀ ਸੁਧ ਪਾੲਿ ਸੁਯੰਬ੍ਰ ਕਰਿਓ || ਅਵਧੇਸ ਨਰੇਸਹ ਚੀਨ੍ਰ ਬਰਿਓ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Jab Hisudh Paae Suyanbra Kario|| Avadh3esdaresah Cheen Barrio||11||
translation: When she grew of age, she selected Dasrath, the king of Oudh, in the ceremony of swayyamvara and married him.11.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨਿ ਸੈਨ ਸਮਿੱਤ੍ਰ ਨਰੇਸ ਬਰੰ || ਜਿਹ ਜੁਧ ਲਯੋ ਮੱਦ੍ਰ ਦੇਸ ਹਰੰ ||
transliteration: Poun(i) Sain Samittra Dares Baran|| Jih Judh Layo Maddra Des Haran||
translation: The mighty and glorious king Sumitra, was the conqueror of Madra Desha.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਮਿਤ੍ਰਾ ਤਿਹ ਧਾਮ ਭੲੀ ਦੁਹਿਤਾ || ਜਿਹ ਜੀਤ ਲੲੀ ਸਸ ਸੂਰ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Soumitraa Tih Dhaam Bhaiduhitaa|| Jih Jeet Laisas Soor Prabhaa||12||
translation: He had a daughter named Sumitra in his home. That virgin was so winsome and radiant that she seemed to have conquered the luster of the sun and moon.12.

gurmukhi: ਸੋੳੂ ਬਾਰਿ ਸਬੁੱਧ ਭੲੀ ਜਬ ਹੀ || ਅਵਧੇਸਹ ਚੀਨ ਬਰਿਓ ਤਬ ਹੀ ||
transliteration: Sooo Daar(i) Sabuddh Bhaijab Hee|| Avdhesah Cheen Barrio Tab Hee||
translation: When she grew of age, she also married the king of Oudh.

gurmukhi: ਗਨ ਯਾਹ ਭਯੋ ਕਸਟੁਅਾਰ ਨ੍ਰਿਪੰ || ਜਿਹ ਕੇਕੲੀ ਧਾਮ ਸੁ ਤਾਸੁ ਪ੍ਰਭੰ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Gad Yaah Bhayo Kastuaar Nripan|| Jih Kekaidh3m Su Taas(u) Prabhan||13||
translation: The same thin happened with the king of Kaikeya, who had glorious daughter named Kaiky.13.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਨ ਤੇ ਗ੍ਹ ਮੋ ਸੁਤ ਜੳੁਨ ਥੀਓ || ਤਬ ਬੈਠ ਨਰੇਸ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕੀਓ ||
transliteration: In Te Grah Mo Sout Jaoun Theeo|| Tab Baith Dares Bichaar Keeo||
translation: The king reflected (in his mind) about the son to be born to his daughter.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਕੇਕੲੀ ਨਾਰ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕਰੀ || ਜਿਹ ਤੇ ਸਸ ਸੂਰਜ ਸੋਭ ਧਰੀ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Tab Kekainaar Bichaar Daree|| Jih Te Sas Sooraj Sobh Ddaree||14||
translation: Kaikeyi also thoutht about it, she was extremely beautiful like the sun and moon.14.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਬਯਾਹਤ ਮਾਂਗ ਲੲੇ ਦੁਬਰੰ || ਜਿਹ ਤੇ ਅਵਧੇਸ ਕੇ ਪ੍ਰਾਣ ਹਰੰ ||
transliteration: Tih Byaahat Maan Lae Doubaran|| Jih Te Avdhes Ke Praan Haran||
translation: On being married she asked for two boons from the king, which ultimately resulted in his death.

gurmukhi: ਸਮਝੀ ਨ ਨਰੇਸਰ ਬਾਤ ਹੀੲੇ || ਤਬ ਹੀ ਤਹ ਕੋ ਬਰ ਦੋੲਿ ਦੀੲੇ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Samjhina Daresar Baat Heee|| Tab Hitah Ko Bar Doe Deee||15||
translation: At that time, the king could not understand the mystery (of the boons) and gave his consent for them.15.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਨ ਦੇਵ ਅਦੇਵਨ ਜੁੱਧ ਪਰੋ || ਜਹ ਜੁੱਧ ਘਣੋ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਅਾਪ ਕਰੋ ||
transliteration: Poun Dev Adevan Juddhdaro|| Jah Juddh Ghano Nrip Aapdaro||
translation: Then once a war was waged between the gods and demons, in which the king gave a tough fight from the side of gods.

gurmukhi: ਹਤ ਸਾਰਥੀ ਸਯੰਦਨ ਨਾਰ ਹਕਿਯੋ || ਯਹ ਕੌਤਕ ਦੇਖ ਨਰੇਸ ਚਕਿਯੋ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Hat Saarthisyandan Naar Hakiyo|| Yah Maoutak Dekh Dares Chakiyo||16||
translation: Then once war charioteer of the king was killed, and instead kaikeyi drave the chariot; on seeing this, the king was nonplussed.16.
